context.p: A Configuration-File represents a file and all associated information related to the file. Each Configuration-File is composed of the file name, type (YAML, JSON, txt) and content.
Create a new Configuration-File within the Configuration Management Portal (CM Portal).
NOTE: This feature is available to all Users.

info.p: Click the Configuration Files link in the navigation bar.
Click the Create new Configuration-File button.
Enter the details as shown below.
NOTE: Any restrictions on the fields are outlined.

ul.li: File Name: Name of the Configuration-File.
Custom File or Drop Down:Select whether the below fields are entered manually or selected from a dropdown menu.
File Type: Type of the Configuration-File - YAML, JSON, or txt
File Content: Contents of the Configuration-File. Note: If Configuration-File type is not JSON, content is saved to configurationFile.content.data so that it is saved as an Object.

info.p: Click the Save button, the Configuration-File will be created, and the user will be redirected back to the view page for the newly created Configuration-File.
NOTE: Configuration-File will not save if any fields are invalid (invalid fields are highlighted in red).

result.p: A New Configuration-File is created in the Configuration Management Portal (CM Portal).
